title: Debate on Batalanda commission report on April 10
byline: The debate on the report of the commission which looked into the unlawful detention camp in Batalanda and it’s activities will be taken up on April 10, 2025, Parliament Media Unit said.

title: Trump administration mulling new travel restrictions on citizens from dozens of countries
byline: The Trump administration is considering issuing travel restrictions for the citizens of dozens of countries as part of a new ban, according to sources familiar with the matter and an internal memo seen by Reuters.

title: At least 31 dead as tornadoes tear through southern US
byline:
At least 31 people have died in the US - including 12 in Missouri alone - after deadly tornadoes tore through several south-eastern states, flipping cars and flattening homes.
In Kansas, at least eight people died after more than 55 vehicles were involved in a crash due to a dust storm.

title: Oscar-winning music director A R Rahman discharged after brief hospitalisation
byline: Top music director A R Rahman, who had been admitted to Apollo Hospitals in Chennai for treatment on Saturday, was discharged on Sunday morning

title: Ranil rejects Batalanda Commission report
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today said he will reject the report of the commission which probed the unlawful detention and Killing of youth in Batalanda.

title: Nick Carter returns home unexpectedly
byline: American singer Nick Carter announced today that he has returned to the USA due to unforeseen circumstances, leading to the suspension of the remaining dates of his ’Who I Am’ Asia tour.

title: Ranil to make special statement on Batalanda Commission
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is to make a special statement on the Batalanda Commission report which was tabled in Parliament by Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayke earlier today.

title: Too late for Ranil to talk about Batalanda now: Nalinda
byline: Claiming that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is now too late to talk about the Batalanda Commission report, Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today the government will take legal action based on the report.

title: Death toll from North Macedonia nightclub fire rises to 59
byline: At least 59 people have been killed and more than 155 injured in a nightclub fire in North Macedonia, officials say.

title: Defect found in oil pipeline from Colombo port
byline: A defect has been discovered in the oil pipelines linking the Colombo Port to the Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminal Limited (CSTL) in Kolonnawa, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) said today.

title: Six arrested over violence at music show
byline: Six individuals have been arrested in connection with the violent incidents that occurred during a musical event at Divulankadawala in Medirigiriya.

title: Sri Lanka seeks JV investments in Bangladesh
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed its willingness to invest in joint ventures in Bangladesh, particularly in synthetic fabric manufacturing, which holds significant potential for investors from both nations, Sri Lankan High Commissioner to Bangladesh Dharmapala Weerakkody said today.

title: Uncertainty still prevails on Adani’s exit from Sri Lanka RE project
byline: “Adani’s haved replied to our letter withing two weeks. The project is still alive,” a senior official with the Sri Lankan government said when asked now that Gautum Adani led entity has expressed its desire to exit the project, whether the project will be offered to other players.

title: Death toll from North Macedonia nightclub fire rises to 59
byline: At least 59 people have been killed and more than 155 injured in a nightclub fire in North Macedonia, officials say.
